snippet: Donald J. Trump’s alienation of key voting blocs has bolstered Democrats in the West and South, and Republicans fear it could be a grim glimpse of their future....
abstract: Donald Trump's candidacy has hastened social and political changes that were already taking place in interior West and upper South by driving women, educated white voters and large number of minorities away from Republican Party; shift is significant enough that Hillary Clinton's campaign has sought to make inroads in historically Republican strongholds like Arizona and Georgia.

byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and ALEXANDER BURNS
byline.contributor: Jonathan Martin reported from Casa Grande, and Alexander Burns from Decatur, Ga.

lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump’s alienation of key voting blocs has bolstered Democrats in the West and South, and Republicans fear it could be a grim glimpse of their future.

headline.main: Trump, Waking a ‘Sleeping Giant,’ Helps Clinton Build an Unlikely Firewall
headline.print_headline: In Changing Regions, Trump Makes Inroads for Democrats
